bio:
Amar Nagaram is the Vice President of Engineering at Flipkart. In his current role, he is heading the Customer Shopping Experience Engineering, Catalog Engineering and FinTech wing, developing products that redefine the shopping experience online and making online shopping affordable . He is passionate about building Mobile and Progressive Web products from the ground-up to deliver superior value and user experience to the end consumer. He is equally passionate about building great teams. He believes in a design language that prefers "People over Pixels". He is excited about start-ups that are solving challenging problems for emerging markets and he works with many such start-ups, mentoring them on all things Mobile. He is also an advisor to half a dozen startups. 

Prior to Flipkart, he worked at @WalmartLabs - he was involved in strategy development for Walmart's next generation e-commerce Platform. He was also instrumental in setting up @walmartlabs India center of excellence.

As highly regulated industries like financial services, healthcare and energy are revolutionised by technology, tight coordination between legal, product and design is critical. Briana and her colleague Izac Ross are looking forward to coming to Dublin and sharing how Collective Health created a collaborative process that allowed us to effect massive change in the US health insurance system.


Briana is a regulatory compliance expert focusing on helping designers and product managers create beautiful, meaningful, and innovative products that comply with highly nuanced areas of law. She brings a diverse approach to her legal practice by integrating legal interpretation with practical process development. She's passionate about improving the way the US pays for healthcare, and her mission is to leave no stone unturned in search of the solution that provides the best consumer experience and health outcome.


Prior to joining Collective Health, Briana developed policy and drafted regulations pursuant to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act ("Obamacare"). She conducted analysis of actuarial value to calculate government subsidies available to individuals and families who buy health insurance. She launched a registration and training program for agents and brokers nationwide, and a program integrity strategy for the Health Insurance Exchanges on the Healthcare.gov platform. 


Prior to her legal career, Briana reviewed tax returns for the US Treasury and taught English in Mexico. When Briana is not noodling on complex legal questions at Collective Health, you can find her crafting, enjoying nature, or doing volunteer tax preparation for low-income families.

Brittni is a product strategist and awareness lead at AJ&Smart. With a background balanced in video advertising and tech, AJ&Smart's efficient and process-driven approach to product design suits her really well. Oh, and she also does stand-up comedy sometimes.

Bryan is the CTO at Skyscanner, responsible for enabling a 400-strong global team of software engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers to earn the trust of hundreds of millions of travelers around the world by delivering a simple, elegant product experience.

Bryan has previously held leadership roles at Amazon Web Services, Skype, and Microsoft.

job_title: Director of Digital Design, Data & Services

bio:
Richard graduated from the University of Newcastle upon Tyne, UK in 1994 with a degree in Software Engineering that he didn't know what to do with. In 1999, two web-design start-ups later, he moved to the US. He's been leading design teams in large organizations ever since, first with Vanguard, then at USAA and now in New York City as Head of Design for Capital One's 450-strong design organization.

Richard is active in the design community, having spoken at conferences across the country on the topics of design leadership, measurement, and the importance of experience management systems. He chaired the 2008 IA Summit in Miami which gave him a new appreciation for conference organizers everywhere.

He has an unhealthy obsession for Mental Model diagrams. His table tennis and juggling are good, his guitar playing is not, and he gets very uncomfortable writing third-person bios of himself.

Clive is a co founder and CTO of Plynk, the money messenger. He is a technology specialist with over 13 years experience in software development across online poker, re-insurance and digital finance. When he's not building Europe's first money messenger he has been known to play a hand or 2 of poker and dabble with improv comedy

Daniel Rolls is a senior developer at Sky where he is responsible for building web services for over the top delivery of video streams. Prior to joining Sky Daniel did a PhD in Computer Science and worked for various organisations including Xerox and The University of Hertfordshire. Daniel questioned the accuracy and interpretation of various metric dashboards and started investigating.

profile_picture.description: David Zalando, Head of Engineering, Zalando

bio: Donal O Mahony is Head of UX and Product Design in Fleetmatics, a Verizon Company. where he leads a team of researchers, content specialists, user experience designers and UI designers. He is responsible for all aspects of user research, product design and user experience and has grown the UX team from a standing start to 30 people within 1 year. Prior to joining Fleetmatics he was Director of UX and Design at HMH's Dublin R&D office, where he led a team of 30 UX and UI designers. He is also a public speaker in the areas of UX and Design and has lectured in Trinity College Dublin and IADT. In a previous life, he was a musician and producer.

Francisco is a Lead Designer at Instacart, a popular grocery delivery service in North America that works in 200 cities and with over 200 grocery partners. At Instacart Francisco works on the Fulfillment team.- the team that makes sure customers get everything they ordered by the time they ordered. This involves working on all of the tools our shoppers in the store and delivery drivers use to do their jobs effectively. Before Instacart, Francisco was at a start-up called Prismatic that was acquired by LinkedIn as an early designer. Francisco did both his undergraduate and graduate programs at Stanford University.

Izac specialises in weaving together methods from interaction design, service management, business strategy and design research to solve problems that go beyond a single device, channel or medium. His mission: create the best possible experience for members of Collective Health.

Izac has a passion for working on complex problems in regulated industries. Prior to joining Collective Health, Izac held positions at Cooper, Moment Design and Philips Design. He has worked for a range of clients in healthcare, financial, and technology verticals including Philips Healthcare, Studio Dental, Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Google, American Express, Morgan Stanley and Bloomberg.

Izac received a BFA in Service Design from Savannah College of Art and Design. When Izac is not designing Collective Health's member experience you will find him improvising in the kitchen, hunting for new music and biking around the city.

As an Experience Designer at Frontend.com John helps define clients' business strategies, products and services through design. He has worked for clients all over the world helping to deliver sustainable and enjoyable customer/user experiences in the fields of healthcare, sport performance, software and fintech. Multi-award winning, John's work on digital government-citizen communication has been published in the peer-reviewed 'Iterations Design Review' journal, and he has also been recognised as a Design for Europe featured designer for his work with the UN's migration body, IOM. 

John is a co-founder and organiser of Ireland's largest design related community, DublinUX, has spoken extensively on the topic of user experience, and is a lecturer of Human-Computer Interaction at the University of Limerick. He holds a BA in Business Studies and a Certificate in Service Design.

John Moriarty is an interaction design lead with Fjord Dublin, part of Accenture's new research and incubation hub. He leads multi-disciplinary design teams working on R&D projects, bringing user centred design and prototyping methods to emerging technology solutions. Prior to joining Fjord, he worked with HMH, building next generation digital education platforms and before that he set up and ran Design Partners' San Francisco product design studio. With a diverse background that spans physical and digital domains, he brings a holistic approach to design thinking and problem solving.

Jonathan Courtney is the co-founder of AJ&Smart, a multi-award winning digital product design agency based in Berlin. He writes a lot, and sometimes causes an industry fire with articles like this. But he also uses his writing for good and helps companies solve difficult design problems with new processes and snappy educational videos.

Jonathan has worked on products for companies like the United Nations, Lufthansa, Udacity, eBay, Zalando, Western Digital, UEFA, Red Bull and many more.


He also runs monthly product design events where he brings the best designers in the world in front of a live audience to nerd out. He's interviewed design leaders from companies like Google, IDEO, Lego, GV, Fjord and many more.

job_title: Head of User Experience and Design

bio:
Krzysztof Jackowski is a passionate developer and overall a very active guy. His technology of choice is Android. Krzysztof has been a specialising in this field for almost 5 years. It all started with an engineering project about Augmented Reality. Krzysztof is also an enthusiast of marketing and IT leadership.

Among many interests and hobbies, he loves travelling and meeting people with different backgrounds. He can always learn something new and exciting from them.

job_title: Chief Platform Architect and Executive Vice President, Engineering
bio: Martin joined Houghton Mifflin Harcourt in 2016 as HMH's first-ever Chief Platform Architect and Executive Vice President of Engineering. With over 20 years of experience in design, development and delivery of industry-leading distributed applications, Martin is responsible for all of HMH's platform development, and provides engineering leadership throughout the organization. Prior to joining HMH, Martin was Vice President of Worldwide Product Engineering for software company Pegasystems, where he led the engineering and development operations aspects of the Pega platform. Previously Martin held a variety of technology leadership roles, including Senior Vice President for Fidelity Investments' Asset Management division. Martin holds a Master of Science in Computer Science and a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics from the University of Kent in Canterbury, England.

Mathias Buus is a self taught Javascript hacker from Copenhagen. He works full time on open source projects and have been working with Node.js since the 0.2 days. Mathias likes to work with P2P and distributed systems and is the author of more than 550 modules on npm, including some of the most popular ones for working with streams. In addition he has spoken about mad science projects at various conferences around the world.

Michael is Co-Founder and CEO of Interplay.io, an innovative new platform which provides the fastest path possible from idea to tested user experience. We do this by integrating with existing design and development tools to enable the creation of fully functional, data-driven prototypes using you own Design System components. Prior to starting Interplay, Michael ran a successful design and development consultancy in Sydney, Australia for over 14 years, providing services to some of the world's largest corporations such as Rio Tinto, ExxonMobil and Cadbury Schweppes.

As the Lead Principal Software Engineer in ASOS Technology, Nik Crabtree is responsible for Software and QA Engineering, UI Engineering and Data Engineering across the organisation. His role has a simple brief: come in every day with one aim - make engineering and engineers at ASOS better. Nik joined ASOS in March 2015 after six years at Avanade where he lead the Cloud & Integration Practice. Nik worked on both Azure and on-premises solutions with customers such as Skype, Blinkbox, Barclays, Best Buy and ASOS.

Noelle LaCharite is an evangelist. She is passionate about voice technology, AI bots and Mindful Leadership. As a Sr. Technical Program Manager at Amazon Alexa, she owns and manages projects that will help define the vision for Alexa's voice experience, drive investments in accuracy and end-to-end voice experience quality and find opportunities for increasing innovation across the data science and engineering teams related to machine learning. She has spent many years as a technical trainer and evangelist for IBM, a Solution Architect for RedHat and in Education Leadership at Amazon Web Services. She has been an enterprise developer, architect and principle consultant over a decade. She has been voted a top 10 presenter at RedHat Summit and has spoken at dozens of technical and digital marketing events. As an Evangelist for voice technologies, she develops demonstrations, white papers and tutorials and speaks at technical conferences, seminars and executive meetings.

Pawel Kontek is a self-taught Product Designer with 3 years of experience. Working at Netguru, he has cooperated with start-ups and mature companies from industries like social care, education, networking and tourism. Recently, Pawel has focused on creating an app which uses psychological tests to help you plan your career path. His cooperation with developers is directed at working out processes which ensure the successful implementation of designers' work.

Richard graduated from the University of Newcastle upon Tyne, UK in 1994 with a degree in Software Engineering that he didn't know what to do with. In 1999, two web-design start-ups later, he moved to the US. He's been leading design teams in large organizations ever since, first with Vanguard, then at USAA and now in New York City as Head of Design for Capital One's 450-strong design organization.

Richard is active in the design community, having spoken at conferences across the country on the topics of design leadership, measurement, and the importance of experience management systems. He chaired the 2008 IA Summit in Miami which gave him a new appreciation for conference organizers everywhere.

He has an unhealthy obsession for Mental Model diagrams. His table tennis and juggling are good, his guitar playing is not, and he gets very uncomfortable writing third-person bios of himself.

Richard Rodger is a co-founder of nearForm.com. Richard is an expert and thought-leader in next-generation enterprise software delivery, with a focus on Node.js and microservices. He is currently writing The Tao of Microservices (available on early release from manning.com/books/the-tao-of-microservices), a comprehensive guide to designing and building microservice systems. His first book Mobile Application Development in the Cloud (Wiley, 2010) is one of the first major works on the intersection of Node.js, Cloud, and Mobile.


Richard was previously CTO of FeedHenry, a mobile application platform provider that was acquired by RedHat for €63.5m in 2014. Since Richard co-founded nearForm in 2011, the company has become the world's largest Node.js and microservices consulting company. Richard has long been an active member and influencer of the open source software (OSS) community, specializing in OSS for enterprise. At nearForm, he has placed OSS at the hear of how the company works. He is the maintainer of senecajs.org, a microservices framework for Node.js that is a key component of nearForm's software development and delivery capability. Richard is the host of the Dublin Microservices Meetup.

Rob Campion is a Tech Lead at HubSpot. Rob is passionate about web development and has worked in the industry for almost 10 years. He began his career at IBM, before moving to MasterCard, Spencer Stuart and finally HubSpot. Since joining HubSpot, he's worked on Website Grader, Customer Success Tooling and currently leads their efforts to transform notifications and communications via in-app, mobile and email messaging.

Rob currently builds web apps using ReactJS. He founded and co-organizes the ReactJS Dublin Meetup, which has grown to over 1,000 members.

Tony has worked in technology for +20 years and was most recently CEO of a global gaming company, Demonware (an Activision company), where he was responsible for amongst other things online communities numbering 10s of millions. Tony has worked for IBM amongst others and is an active angel investor in Ireland.
